abstract: Study published in Systematic Entomology claims that migration northwards of two new bee species sheds light on Panama's history as land bridge between South and Central America.
snippet: Two newly described species in Panama and Colombia descend from stingless bees that moved north from the Amazon long before the Panama land bridge is thought to have formed.
lead_paragraph: Two newly described species in Panama and Colombia descend from stingless bees that moved north from the Amazon long before the Panama land bridge is thought to have formed.

headline.main: Bees’ Migration Holds Clues to Geologic History
headline.print_headline: Bees’ Migration Holds Clues to Geologic History
